attribute.description: The frequency of a processor's nest mesh clock, in MHz. This is the same for all chips in the system. Provided by the MRW.
The frequency of a processor's A link clocks, in MHz. This is the same for all chips in the system. Provided by the MRW.
The frequency of a processor's X link clocks, in MHz. This is the same for all chips in the system. Provided by the MRW.
The lowest frequency that a core can be set to in MHz. This is the same for all cores in the system. Provided by the MRW.
The nominal core frequency in MHz. This is the same for all cores in the system. Provided by the MRW.
The maximum core frequency in MHz. This is the same for all cores in the system. Provided by the MRW.
The frequency of a processor's PCI-e bus in MHz. This is the same for all PCI-e busses in the system. Provided by the MRW.
Set to force all fabric asynchronous boundary crossings into safe mode.
Processor SMP A bus width. Provided by the MRW.
Processor SMP X bus width. Provided by the MRW.
Processor SMP core floor/nest frequency ratio
attribute.enum: RATIO_8_8 = 0x0, RATIO_7_8 = 0x1, RATIO_6_8 = 0x2, RATIO_5_8 = 0x3, RATIO_4_8 = 0x4, RATIO_2_8 = 0x5

attribute.description: Processor SMP core celing/nest frequency ratio
attribute.enum: RATIO_8_8 = 0x0, RATIO_7_8 = 0x1, RATIO_6_8 = 0x2, RATIO_5_8 = 0x3, RATIO_4_8 = 0x4, RATIO_2_8 = 0x5

attribute.description: Processor SMP Fabric broadcast scope configuration. CHIP_IS_NODE = MODE1 = default CHIP_IS_GROUP = MODE2 Provided by the MRW.
Processor SMP topology configuration. 0 = default = 1 or 2 hop topology (PHYP image spans system) 1 = 3 hop topology (PHYP image spans group). Provided by the MRW.
Per-link optics configuration 0 = default = SMP 1 = CAPI 2.0 2 = NV 2.0 Provided by the MRW.
Processor SMP optics mode. 0 = default = Optics_is_X_bus 1 = Optics_is_A_bus Provided by the MRW.
Per-link optics configuration 0 = default = SMP 1 = CAPI 2.0 2 = NV 2.0
Processor CAPI attachement protocol mode. 0 = default = no: SMPA CAPI attachement 1 = yes: SMPA CAPI attachement Provided by the MRW.
Processor memory map configuration. 0 = default = large system address map 1 = small system address map Provided by the MRW.
Logical fabric system ID associated with this chip.Provided by the MRW.
Logical fabric group ID associated with this chip.Provided by the MRW.
Logical fabric chip ID associated with this chip.Provided by the MRW.
Indicates if the given chip should serve as the fabric system master.
Indicates if the given chip should serve as the fabric group master.
For each fabric X link on this chip, specifies whether or not the chip at the receiving end of the link is present and configured
For each fabric A link on this chip, specifies whether or not the chip at the receiving end of the link is present and configured

For each fabric X link on this chip, specifies the fabric ID of the chip at the receiving end of the link. Should be considered valid only if corresponding ATTR_PROC_FABRIC_X_ATTACHED_CHIP_CNFG index is true.

For each fabric X link on this chip, specifies the link ID of the chip at the receiving end of the link. Should be considered valid only if corresponding ATTR_PROC_FABRIC_X_ATTACHED_CHIP_CNFG index is true.

For each fabric A link on this chip, specifies the fabric ID of the chip at the receiving end of the link. Should be considered valid only if corresponding ATTR_PROC_FABRIC_A_ATTACHED_CHIP_CNFG index is true.

For each fabric A link on this chip, specifies the link ID of the chip at the receiving end of the link. Should be considered valid only if corresponding ATTR_PROC_FABRIC_A_ATTACHED_CHIP_CNFG index is true.
Indicates if X links on this chip should be configured in aggregate mode.
Indicates if link should be used to carry data only (in aggregate configurations). Should be considered valid only if corresponding ATTR_PROC_FABRIC_X_ATTACHED_CHIP_CNFG index is true.

Average of local/remote end link delay counter values. Used to designate coherent link in aggregate configurations. Should be considered valid only if corresponding ATTR_PROC_FABRIC_X_ATTACHED_CHIP_CNFG index is true.
Indicates if A links on this chip should be configured in aggregate mode.
Indicates if link should be used to carry data only (in aggregate configurations). Should be considered valid only if corresponding ATTR_PROC_FABRIC_A_ATTACHED_CHIP_CNFG index is true.

Average of local/remote end link delay counter values. Used to designate coherent link in aggregate configurations. Should be considered valid only if corresponding ATTR_PROC_FABRIC_A_ATTACHED_CHIP_CNFG index is true.
Guardband percentage to apply to baseline epsilon calculations
Processor epsilon table type. Used to calculate the processor nest epsilon register values. Provided by the MRW.
Calculated read tier0 epsilon protection count.
Calculated read tier1 epsilon protection count.
Calculated read tier2 epsilon protection count.
Calculated write tier1 epsilon protection count.
Calculated write tier2 epsilon protection count.
Define DMI Ref clock/Swizzle for Centaur. Provided by the MRW
Define context for current phase of system IPL. Provided by the platform.
Indicates if current IPL is memory-preserving
Defines XSCOM base address on each processor level. address provided by the MRW

Define placement policy/scheme for non-mirrored/mirrored memory layout NORMAL = non-mirrored start: 0, mirrored start: 1024TB FLIPPED = mirrored start: 0, non-mirrored start: 512TB Set by platform. Used by mss_eff_grouping

The location where the stacking of non-mirrored memory groups of the chip starts. This address is determined in a fixed manner from the chip's position in the fabric topology (i.e. each chip will consume a fixed portion of the system address map). Set by p9_mss_eff_grouping.
The non-mirrored memory base addresses of the groups formed by the memory grouping process. Set by p9_mss_eff_grouping. Used by p9_setup_bars and platforms (dev tree).

The non-mirrored memory sizes of the groups formed by the memory grouping process. These values reflect the usable amount of memory covered by the group. Set by p9_mss_eff_grouping. Used by p9_setup_bars and platforms (dev tree, build winkle img)

The location where the stacking of mirrored memory groups of the chip starts. This address is determined in a fixed manner from the chip's position in the fabric topology (i.e. each chip will consume a fixed portion of the system address map). Set by p9_mss_eff_grouping.
The mirrored memory base addresses of the groups formed by the memory grouping process. Set by p9_mss_eff_grouping. Used by p9_setup_bars.

The mirrored memory sizes of the groups formed by the memory grouping process. These values reflect the usable amount of mirrored memory covered by the group. Set by p9_mss_eff_grouping. Used by p9_setup_bars and platforms (dev tree, build winkle img)

Creator :- mss_setup_bars consumer :- platform A 8 bit vector that would be a designation of which MC are involved in the group. So the bits would represent MC0,MC1,MC2,MC3,MC4,MC5,MC6,MC7 -what is grouped into the first would go into [0], the 2nd group into entry [1] and so on.
Creator:- mss_setup_bars A numerical number indicating if the memory procedures are complete. written by mss_setup_bars when the bars are now functional in the processor.

If this attribute sets to TRUE, supports MCS grouping with out mirroring. If this attribute to FALSE, IBM Power system Mirroring support enabled. This instructs the grouping code to group contiguous memory controllers of the same size together. Provided by the MRW.

The base addresses where the HTM traces start. They are calculated based on the HTM trace sizes requested by users. There are two different HTM trace areas, thus two different base addresses. Platform is to initialize this attribute to 0 (default). Set by p9_mss_eff_grouping. Used by p9_setup_bars.

The amount of memory a user can reserve to store HTM traces. There are two different HTM trace areas, thus two different sizes (For example, one to store NHTM0 and one forNHTM1). Platform is to initialize this attribute to 0 (default). Set by user via attribute override. Used by p9_mss_eff_grouping.

The base address where the OCC sandbox starts. It is calculated based on the OCC sandbox size requested by users. Platform is to initialize this attribute to 0 (default). Set by p9_mss_eff_grouping. Used by p9_setup_bars.
The amount of memory a user can reserve to store OCC sandbox functions. Platform is to initialize this attribute to 0 (default). Set by user via attribute override. Used by p9_mss_eff_grouping.

The actual non-mirrored base addresses of the groups formed by the memory grouping process. These values correspond to the BAR programming and would be acknowleged on the fabric. Set by p9_mss_eff_grouping. Used by p9_setup_bars.
The actual non-mirrored memory sizes of the groups formed by the memory grouping process. These values correspond to the BAR programming. Set by p9_mss_eff_grouping. Used by p9_setup_bars.

The actual mirrored base addresses of the groups formed by the memory grouping process. These values correspond to the BAR programming and would be acknowleged on the fabric. Set by p9_mss_eff_grouping. Used by p9_setup_bars.
The actual mirrored memory sizes of the groups formed by the memory grouping process. These values correspond to the BAR programming. Set by p9_mss_eff_grouping. Used by p9_setup_bars.
